alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Red River; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:13PM CST until January 02 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN DE SOTO...RED RIVER...NORTHWESTERN NATCHITOCHES AND NORTH CENTRAL SABINE PARISHES... At 413 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Coushatta, or 15 miles east of Mansfield, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Coushatta, Pleasant Hill, Martin, Ashland, Edgefield, Lake End, Evelyn, Grand Bayou, Hanna, Loggy Bayou, Pelican, Crichton, Rambin, Armistead and Ajax. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for northwestern Louisiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
